fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Culture and media, Trade, Competition, Culture, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Digital economy and society, Communication
eu_initiatives:
- EU Digital Single Market, especially copyright and e-commerce 
 
- open standards, e.g., ICT Standardisation in the EU 
 
- privacy 
 
- platform regulation 
 
- e-commerce 
 
- digital trade 
 
- encryption
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: While not a "member," in 2018 GitHub is a supporter of OpenForumEurope, www.openforumeurope.org.
goals__remit:
GitHub is the world’s largest software development platform, enabling users and businesses to collaboratively develop 76+ million open-source and proprietary software projects. GitHub’s global community of 27+ million users globally and 5+ million in Europe includes individual developers, startups, small businesses, large companies, NGOs, and governments. GitHub-hosted software projects include applications designed for web or mobile devices, as well as the source code that powers entire businesses. Developers on GitHub work together, sharing code and knowledge, to build the future of software. 
 
Through its policy work, GitHub works to advance positive outcomes for software developers, our broader community of users, and the software development ecosystem on issues such as copyright, open standards, open source software, platform regulation, free expression, and privacy.
relevant_communication: GitHub contributed to OpenForumEurope's white paper, "European Copyright Reform: Impact on Free and Open Source Software and Developer Communities" https://savecodeshare.eu/static/assets/WhitePaper-ImpactofArticel13onSoftwareEcosystem-SaveCodeShare.pdf and has made blog posts on the same topic, see https://blog.github.com/2018-03-14-eu-proposal-upload-filters-code/ and https://blog.github.com/2018-04-30-eu-upload-filters-response/
